places.name: Jaigarh Fort
places.description: A formidable fort located on a hilltop overlooking the Amber Fort. It houses the world's largest cannon on wheels, Jaivana, and offers panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.

places.name: Albert Hall Museum
places.description: A museum located in the heart of Jaipur, housing a vast collection of artifacts, including paintings, sculptures, and decorative arts. The architecture of the building itself is worth admiring.

places.name: Jal Mahal
places.description: A picturesque palace situated amidst the Man Sagar Lake, with its lower floors submerged in water. It offers a serene ambiance and is ideal for photography.

places.name: Galtaji (Monkey Temple)
places.description: An ancient Hindu pilgrimage site known for its natural springs and temples surrounded by monkeys. It offers a serene and spiritual atmosphere away from the city's hustle and bustle.

places.name: Chokhi Dhani
places.description: A recreated Rajasthani village offering an immersive cultural experience. Visitors can enjoy traditional folk performances, camel rides, puppet shows, and authentic Rajasthani cuisine.
